name: Honkaku Shogi: Fuuunji Ryuuou
overview: Honkaku Shogi: Fuuunji Ryuuou ("Authentic Shogi: Dragon King Soldier of Fortune") is a shogi game for the Super Famicom. It was developed by Aisystem Tokyo and published by the UK company Virgin Interactive. It would be one of two Virgin Interactive games released on the 22th of December in 1994 exclusively in Japan, the first being Battle Jockey. The player can select exhibition and tournament matches against opponents in increasingly difficult games of shogi. The "Dragon King" of the title ("Ryuuou") is also the name of an upgraded rook in shogi.
